sense.name: the earth's organic surface layer of dirt
sense.examples: Soybeans and corn like a good rich soil. The farmers could barely scratch a living from the thin, rocky soil. These contoured fields help prevent soil erosion.

sense.name: being in an unclean state, stained, filthy
sense.examples: These plastic covers will protect your sofa cushions from soil. Their morals were impeccable, without soil.

sense.name: material substance that is considered waste, refuse, sewage
sense.examples: The villagers collect night soil to be used as fertilizer on the crops. (human excrement) The neglected infant had lain in his own soil for days. This water is contaminated with soil from the city sewers.

sense.name: territory under jurisdiction of a sovereign nation
sense.examples: He will be arrested as soon as he steps onto U.S. soil. They were against the stationing of foreign troops on Japanese soil. She wanted to kiss the soil of the Irish village where she was born. (emphasis on place, but could also be Sense 1 if taken literally)

sense.name: a nurturing medium for growth or development
sense.examples: The Garden State has provided fertile soil for the specialty beer market. (it sells well there) The local tales of the fishermen provided rich soil for the writer's new screenplay.
